segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
18. Intention
175. With Upavāṇa

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upavāṇo yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā upavāṇo āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Upavāṇa sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, vijjāyantakaro hotī”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, do you become a terminator because of knowledge?”
“That’s not it, reverend.”
“Do you become a terminator because of conduct?”
“That’s not it, reverend.”
“Do you become a terminator because of both knowledge and conduct?”
“That’s not it, reverend.”
“Do you become a terminator for some reason other than knowledge and conduct?”
“That’s not it, reverend.”

segments.pli: “‘Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, vijjāyantakaro hotī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, when asked whether you become a terminator because of knowledge or conduct or knowledge and conduct, or for some other reason,
you say ‘that’s not it’.

segments.pli: ‘Kiṃ panāvuso sāriputta, caraṇenantakaro hotī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
‘Kiṃ panāvuso sāriputta, vijjācaraṇenantakaro hotī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
‘Kiṃ panāvuso sāriputta, aññatra vijjācaraṇenantakaro hotī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:

segments.en: How then do you become a terminator?”

segments.pli: “Vijjāya ce, āvuso, antakaro abhavissa, saupādānova samāno antakaro abhavissa.
segments.en: “Reverend, if you became a terminator because of knowledge, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.

segments.pli: Caraṇena ce, āvuso, antakaro abhavissa, saupādānova samāno antakaro abhavissa.
segments.en: If you became a terminator because of conduct, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.

segments.pli: Vijjācaraṇena ce, āvuso, antakaro abhavissa, saupādānova samāno antakaro abhavissa.
segments.en: If you became a terminator because of both knowledge and conduct, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.

segments.pli: Aññatra vijjācaraṇena ce, āvuso, antakaro abhavissa, puthujjano antakaro abhavissa.
segments.en: If you became a terminator for some reason other than knowledge and conduct, then even an ordinary person could be a terminator.
For an ordinary person lacks knowledge and conduct.

segments.pli: Caraṇavipanno kho, āvuso, yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati.
segments.en: Reverend, someone lacking good conduct does not know and see things as they are.
Someone accomplished in good conduct knows and sees things as they are.
Knowing and seeing things as they are, one is a terminator.”

suttaplex.blurb: A “terminator” is someone who has made an end of suffering. But are they defined by knowledge or conduct?
